Gabrielle Giffords is making progress every day. She's using both sides of her body. She's able to breathe on her own. She's able to open her eyes and to show people she understands what she's hearing and seeing, Kirsten Gillibrand said. week after Nokia Oyj announced the platform will be its primarily mobile- phone software, will get additional features this year such as Internet Explorer 9, Twitter and multitasking capabilities, Steve Ballmer said. Increasingly, consumers, developers and mobile operators won't just choose a phone, they're really choosing a platform, he said. Microsoft is pulling out all the stops to reverse market share declines in its mobile-phone software as smartphone sales look set to pass those of personal computers in the next two years. ," he added. "Not to be all self-serving, but I read Google's mgmt shakeup as a confession that the co is a decision-making mess losing its way in search," adding: Ask employees. Any engineer with initiative has been going mad at processes and vacillation. Why would that mean Eric Schmidt should go? Because the arrangement in which he was chief executive and Page and Sergey Brin , the co-founders, had an equal role eventually has led to drift. Google needs

Brin, and Eric Schmidt threatened to put Google at a competitive disadvantage as younger, more nimble Internet services such as Facebook pounce on new trends to lure away users and advertisers." Page told the AP: My goal is to run Google at the pace and with the soul and passion of a startup. I think I will have time to do that given the way we have split up our responsibilities.
